name: The Mets of the Sixties Quiz | MLB Teams | 10 Questions

questions.text: What position was played by the Mets very first draft choice?
questions.explanation:
Catcher.

	Hobie Landrith. 'You have to have a catcher - or everything the pitcher throws will roll to the back.' Good old Casey Stengel.

questions.text: Who was the Mets first manager?
questions.explanation:
Casey Stengel.

	Colorful. 'Can't anyone here play this game?'

questions.text: The Mets went through a ton of third basemen. Which of the following was a third baseman for them?
questions.explanation:
Charlie Neal.

	All were Met infielders. Hunt was solid.

questions.text: One of the highlights during the early years included a Perfect Game that was tossed against the Mets on Father's Day. Who was the pitcher that threw it?
questions.explanation:
Jim Bunning.

	With the Phillies. Game One of a doubleheader.

questions.text: Another highlight involved the Mets losing a 23 inning game. Who won?
questions.explanation:
Giants.

	Jim Davenport got the key hit. It was Game Two of a doubleheader.

questions.text: Steve Carlton struck out 19 Mets - but lost the game, 4-3, when this player hit 2 two-run homers.
questions.explanation:
Ron Swoboda.

	'Rocky' as he was called by some. The others were also good outfielders.

questions.text: Tom Seaver almost pitched a perfect game; it was broken up in the ninth inning. Who got the hit?
questions.explanation:
Jimmy Qualls.

	Woodward, a light hitter, did well against Seaver - but it was Qualls who got the hit.

questions.text: Who did the '69 Mets beat in the World Series?
Which of the following was primarily a relief pitcher?
questions.explanation:
Ron Taylor.

	The others were starters.

questions.text: Who was heralded by the original Mets when they signed him as a 17-year old?
questions.explanation:
Ed Kranepool.

	'Kid Kranepool' played first base.
